subject: Re: Website issue? Case Study page not working
preview: Hi Iolanda,  Thanks for this.  I totally understand that we cannot ask our clients to check the errors on our website and I know we need to make sure there are no errors at all. But for now, with the

full_threads.body:
Hi Iolanda,

Thanks for this.

I totally understand that we cannot ask our clients to check the errors on our website and I know we need to make sure there are no errors at all. But for now, with the website we are dealing with at the moment, this is not something I can fully guarantee. I am just asking to flag everything that they mention when they actively do give their feedback, so I can fix this right away.

I am happy that you share this feedback with me. This proves that the website is a really important part of the client journey. If we want to attract tech companies like Google, we really need to level with them and invest in our online presence. I am working on that 😊.

Met vriendelijke groet, kind regards,

Suzan Nievergeld
+31 611592446



Veldhoen + Company BV

Lichttoren 32
5611 BJ EINDHOVEN

The Netherlandswww.veldhoencompany.comHandelsregister 14629763

Follow us on

Hi Suzan

Google team - whom I am trying to build a relationship with, told me they cant see case studies on our website…they tried different browsers. I think it is helpful if you check this indeed as more case studies might have the sam problem. I can't ask the customer to identify that for us☺

However the message below came from a potential candidate who was also struggling to find out more about us and she could not access 'any' of the case studies she said

Thanks

Iolanda Meehan

Managing Partner

Veldhoen + Company SEA Pte Ltd

+65 81810841 | iolanda@veldhoencompany.com | www.veldhoencompany.com

Hi Iolanda,

To my understanding there was an issue with the total case study part on our website. This is fixed now, so all studies should work and if not, there is another problem we have to find and fix. I will do a check myself to be sure that everything works well, but please let me know if you find or hear about an error somewhere.

Met vriendelijke groet, kind regards,

Suzan Nievergeld

Thanks Suzan
When you have some time, Can you pls check the other case studies work? I got few complaints about multiple case studies.

Iolanda

Many thanks for your quick response Joel. Appreciated!

roel@veldhoencompany.com, luc@veldhoencompany.com, Iolanda@veldhoencompany.com FYI

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi there,


Hope you had a lovely easter weekend 😊. There seems to be an issue with the case study plugin. When clicking on a case study, a 'critical error' turns up. Can't find the issue myself, it's probably an error in the CMS? There needs to be done some updating on our website as well since the health status is not that good either and maybe this could cause the bad performance and error. Could you help out with fixing the problem(s)? I know it's time for a new website but in the meantime we need to work with this one.


Met vriendelijke groet, kind regards,

Suzan Nievergeld

Hi there
Pls see below. I got the same from a Google contact who wanted to find out more about our case studies.

Do we know what causes this?

Many thanks



Begin forwarded message:

From: Karen Smits <ksmits@hotmail.com>
Date: 4 April 2021 at 22:04:52 GMT+8
To: Iolanda Meehan <Iolanda@veldhoencompany.com>
Subject: Website issue? Case Study page not working

Hi Iolanda,

How are you?

In preparation for the meeting with Martijn and Desmond (on Tuesday) I wanted to read some more case studies on the Veldhoen + company website, but on both the English and Dutch version I receive the following error:



You may want to look into this. And IT may want to know I'm receiving the same error in Safari and Chrome browser, both on my cell phone.

In the meantime, is there another way I could read more of the case studies? Any additional suggestions on how I could prepare for the chat are welcome too!

I look forward to speaking with your colleagues!

Kind regards,
Karen
